alert.note: Alert for Garland; Hot Spring (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 6:56PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Garland and west central Hot Spring Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 655 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Meyers, or 16 miles southwest of Hot Springs, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hot Springs... Hot Springs Memorial Field... Lofton... Rockwell... Hot Springs National Park... Red Oak... De Roche... Oaklawn Racetrack... Pettyview... Hempwallace... Pearcy... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central and southwestern Arkansas.
